column4: I'm having a problem with Ubuntu Install CD. Buffer I/O error on fd0, Status: {DRDY}
- do you have a floppy drive??
Yeah, I do
I do
- is it a removable drive? Dell floppy module?
Uh
I don't think so
Danand - Keep forgetting to highlight - I don't think so.
Danand - If this helps, I'm using a HP Pavilion 513n, from 2003
- :) I had this problem when installing on my laptop. Does the error message repeat?
- Yeah. It also seems to do that when I try booting Debian without Single User MOde

- if so leave it a while. Usually the message repeats for a while (5 mins) and then the install carries on as normal. Might be due to over zealous hardware detection on the install cd. Just give it a while...
Danand - The error keeps repeating itself both when I try using the Ubuntu install CD, and when I try booting Debian outside of Single User Mode
- is the Pavillion a desktop or laptop?
- Desktop
- do you know if the floppy drive works ok or not? :)
- I have tried using it before with floppies, and it does not work.
- hmmm.... Have you thought of just unplugging it from the mainboard??
- Alright I'll try that after, it should do it. I have to go right now, but thank you for your help
- np :)
